Visibility:
From here, you can set some global parameters for the particle node, such as its name, 
the number of particles to be generated, and other particle settings.
When this instance should copy its parent node's position
When this instance should copy its parent node's rotation
When this instance should copy its parent node's scale
Length of time each instance survives
Amount of time that must elapse after instance spawns before it starts generating.
Whether generation is enabled at the start of playback.
Destroys when the specified trigger fires.
Switch between continuous spawning and trigger-based bursts.
Trigger that spawns particles when generation mode is Trigger.
Number of particles generated each time the trigger fires.
